Spudly, okay... Is there a webpage that just shows dapper --> Hardy upgrade, manual?

Its pretty simple.  Make sure you have your kernel metapackage, ubuntu-standard, ubuntu-minimal, and any other metapackages (apache2, for instance) installed.  Make sure you're up to date with dapper (that includes dapper-updates).  Disable any third party repos (hopefully none, if there are, and if they are used heavily, you'll need to evaluate their effect on the upgrade).  then change dapper to hardy in sources.list, update, and dist-up
